posts.body: Are you the one who maintains the Git? If so, check your E-mail.

I'm mostly here to keep an eye on things.

>>cb146da9-8c01-4fb2-aecc-6c9277b7802a
>I really wish people will just fucking learn that there's a very clear tradeof between quality and the number of people using it.
While it's immediately apparent 4/v/ speed would be disastrous, too far in the other direction is also terrible and 8/v/ outside of specific threads was getting too slow.

>>6f7a946f-84b7-45b8-a902-09a96e1b0cf3
Doesn't it just take one bad actor to keep the image hanging around or is there more to it than that?

>>584742e8-46ac-4665-9159-53fc33d219a9
Most likely no. You have to explicitly seed it. Either way posting large images and especially unoptimized GIFs should be discouraged.

>>1518c658-3204-4cb1-8f32-c46fe83658de
It depends what you want. If you just want to talk video games there's no need to go underground. Even if you want a /v/ that has politics, that's manageable. The problem is being on the same site as a board attracting and celebrating mass-murderers. Historically /b/ tarred 4chan with the same brush but that was comparatively mild.

We can cross-link the two if necessary. Millchan /v/

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1BaEfL5xcUvVebHkH3hgkKZNqESs2Pzbe4:v:0

Millchan root.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/

Incidentally how well does this handle seeding as far as files? Is it based on their hash like 8chan to avoid duplication and such?

>>f8078d24-07a0-4d35-bef5-43786d0645c9
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet#other-platforms-install-from-source

It's basically a Python daemon you run and access through localhost in a web browser. Kind of a neat setup and very easy.

>>f8fcd111-d946-424b-ad95-79c155ece9eb
Untrue. Even as someone who loathes politics infecting everywhere, and typically stays out of it, I would not want for any other community. Imageboards are my preferred format, and 8/v/ is just right in terms of speed and signal-to-noise, and generally what games people want to talk about. 4chan is insufferable.

>>7fe4ded9-feb2-4ca5-8e5b-c63094794dfc
Centralize here, agreed.

Can you access Zeronet without being on localhost, say if I wanted to offload it to my spare SBC? I normally have my laptop running all the time but as an offline thing it'd be handy.

>>c70dcd7a-f7d4-404b-988a-fb7b4abdb883
I'm not without a way to spoiler. I just want to post lewds sometimes. It's an urge. Doing APNG tricks is too expensive here.

>>25f6eb4c-fbdb-48e7-8d34-67985a4b7cf3
Underground licking wounds and not talking about video games, while I'm fine here for organizing and emergency, it really isn't my preferred day-to-day.

As far as getting the word out, all I can really do is stick a PSA on the Vita general guides but those threads are fairly quiet. Technically I can do that with the share thread Git as well but A: where should I put it, and B: I'd rather run it past the actual owner as a MR and I don't know if he made the thread in here or not or knows of Zeronet for that matter. >>586d40d7-2869-4ae5-b40b-cf48fc568548 Is the E-mail on the top correct because otherwise I've likely sent it to a dead one.

>>22217ba4-04af-49e7-8dcf-c6b094aef120
Don't you have a grip in the lower-right of the text box you can drag?

>>1f7511db-d539-47dd-a4cf-4d6ee2dfe8fa
Quite. **WebM no WebM.**

>>80a490bf-b65f-4079-aab6-7db4ee182e72
They don't know autism, plus I suspect the site will make a momentary return, enough to plan things out for real, as should have been done. /a/ had the forethought.

>>ccae7793-13db-401e-8cee-efa610d05178
Try contacting him on the e-hentai forums? Unless anyone has a better plan.

https://exhentai.org/uploader/Longsworduser

>>f5637910-d767-4aa6-929a-2214ebf99718
Don't do that. You should ''always'' be fetching from Git. Better yet, clone the repository and just run "git pull" on it once in a while then you have it and everything else, and the entire history up to that point.
**It feels weird to see unspoilered lewds.**

>>14129b61-7637-4abe-9d0f-16c67d84f04d
Unfortunately the bigger issue with this is spam and CP since the moderation functions are lacking, and sadly this is even true on Millchan for now.

Incidentally, people using SBCs (RasPis and their ilk) can set this up as a permanent thing, just substitute localhost for your local IP address. I'm about to do just that.

>>eace4265-feaa-4ec4-af59-ceffce7de8d1
To me it's just a holding pattern until hopefully 8chan gets brought back up and we can muster a real back-up plan. When it comes down to it I just want to be back with you.

>playing
At the moment I'm more into watching anime while I wait for the situation to unfold. The game I should be playing is Trillion though, it's a neat idea albeit somewhat bare-bones in gameplay.

>>386f722d-2613-43f5-986d-e654c5c09583
The problem is decentralized isn't that suited to porn surges. It's fantastic for text though. The one other serious problem is inability to archive posts easily, though this is partly alleviated by de-centralizing it, don't forget posts are editable.

>>a6b8998b-3b49-43ba-bd7f-a3c527ce8ea7
Wait where is the spoiler option?!

>>f37e5039-559a-4ed4-9f03-bf9829e6d287
Don't think you replied to the right person originally but that's fine, I was curious anyway. Secondary question: Are ZeroNet Git clones "portable" that is can I move them off my laptop onto my single board computer, and retain all the state? Then the intent is while at home I use that as my ZeroNet provider instead of localhost, and out and about have a secondary one on the laptop itself.

posts.subject: sage
posts.body:
As nice as it is to have free-flowing anime titties it is impolite, and yes there is a spoiler feature. Select files, then check the checkbox next to the [X] for images you want kept modest, yes it is possible to do individual images not all or nothing.

While I'm at it, sage test.

>>7fa0a80c-7e15-428c-b4da-657981d5e76f
How do you pin?

Also you could probably get creative with LUKS containers that are set to random keys, or to a RAM disk if you have the RAM.

>>d08c0197-b004-4cae-ab91-22db1cb197d0
Done and done. Also people who haven't done so need to click the ZeroNet icon and see the stat tracker it's interesting and detailed.
>United States 495 peers
>United Kingdom 72 peers
>Australia 70 peers
Oh god I'm just realizing just how atrocious this is with CPU consumption if only a few threads are open. I am on a toaster but still, even the bloat that is 8chan is manageable.

>>44881aca-4819-49ff-b647-b929b8939464
It's the browser eating the CPU not ZeroNet, but it's especially horrible on bigger threads. Maybe that's  a consequence of a thread that's too long and/or that I pinned it. 8chan becomes pretty awful with long threads too. but I usually have 10-20 tabs open there.

>>de2a0e9b-b596-4313-b940-fefcfebf67d8
This is how you should be doing it honestly, since it also means you can ^C it away if necessary.

Glad at least one of us found their way here. Despite all the trouble I've been busy archiving Nep works. Got most of the non-H uploaded, and also some H but I have more to download. Feel free to request specific things but I'm ignoring most of it.

https://mega.nz/#F!ZItDBAAb!ymBruHzMaLaiK1UWK1ZwBQ

Also realized that one "soydomy" page is dangerously close to instant loss 2koma and decided to parody that one Touhou work. **Sorry.**

>>7afcec96-f642-4690-8b30-b20db8b9af7a
If anything goes wrong it's Mega's fault.
megadl 'https://mega.nz/#F!ZItDBAAb!ymBruHzMaLaiK1UWK1ZwBQ'
Get to it.

>>391bcf41-e758-4f0c-81c5-597c0e2c1df8
You miss nothing lewd. Sorry.
What do you mean by "drag the sidebar"

>>6e1704f0-cd98-461f-877f-bb54606a621d
Thanks, on it.

>>7b595403-fc4d-4b18-8400-510549302480
If I did it successfully you win a free lewd.

>>7f4c2261-e240-4103-845d-4a17c2fa2632
Wow, good work with that.

>>7489e2d8-abf2-47fc-a27d-0080c5092d13
What? Also I am still adding things, just it's rate-limited.

>>cff463d8-f196-4d77-80d6-938a32d274b9
ZeroNet itself doesn't do it, but huge threads are a major problem. Threads should probably stop at 250 posts max, and make a new one.

>>93a472f4-a81b-45b1-8890-8d991a1d53b7
Any of them? Maybe you can't post images without port forwarding? Can you go to the main status page and say what yours are while posting an image?

>>b2460c19-1383-439c-8abc-e6ef1c676b20
I can't see yours either. The problem with this site's overall model is everything is distributed but like with torrents, sometimes the seeds die out. Some of them only have 1-3.

Go to the main status page and then the files tab and you can see stats of that nature.
I can't actually set up port forwarding, is it necessary to serve things to other peers, or in that state is it only possible to distribute to other peers?

>>a39c29cc-2553-4e90-ae66-afb0adb6c9d2
They probably just take time to propagate actually. Some other anon said it best: 08chan is like a torrent with too many leeching faggots. It is possible to "pin" a board on here by going to the main list which improves your capability to seed things, I'm not sure of the details.

>>6a7b72af-2f74-4d8c-a59e-15c2467c93e4
You're visible.

>>79c755ae-3a2c-445f-b79e-d3c40b6fb5d3
>>55f8ef8e-bb27-445f-85df-732172058e47
So you two and me makes three, probably 4 from the earlier posts but I want to know accurately just how many of us found here. The other place to chase is Mark's temporary bunker.
https://vch.moe/v/res/7.html
I'm also on /a/'s bunker where a shit-ton is going on given they were the most sensible in having a plan B.

>>19ab98a7-decd-48e3-8aee-d33fce89e611
The stat side of it is not reliable except as a rough "network health". The main problem here is threads start becoming very CPU-intensive around 100-200 posts. This is amazing for just being here when we need it but as a regular hang-out I would really hope not to.

>mark's bunker seems even more dead judging by the threads, no?
In fairness he made it post-mortem and could only announce it on Twitter, while this has sort of been a back-up plan that didn't get ingrained enough. My biggest hope right now is 8chan to at least pop up long enough to get the message out.

>>5bd33882-9f18-4771-bb0f-7a1a8f0d4f4a
Don't be too sure yet, there is possible hope for the site to be brought back up. But if so /v/ need to have a real plan this time.

>>92eb094b-6ac0-4da2-a0ed-21621ab153cc
Fixed, with extras.

>>ea44e3b9-4245-41a3-a89e-9d9dd07dc187
>>9031112d-5cad-4df0-a290-864f38c62abc
>seeding intensifies
**If .pdf trick works...**

>>6e4269c4-8969-4eb2-bd48-fb17518090af
I suspect most people are just waiting and seeing. Just chill and enjoy Neps.
Test, and how do you link cross-board, or do hyperlinks?
Didn't seem to work?

>>0470d945-d714-4dc9-b290-55b7f443b479
>I suspect most people are just waiting and seeing. Just chill and enjoy Neps.
Need to test again since this >>15be88f1-8dd6-4220-91a7-04f2b129b384 post failed.
